page.title: 10TELEPHONE SERVICE
page.content: Canna subscribers are connected to Mallaig, as are the other Small Isles, by a radio link. Before 1966 the service was totally inadequate. In 1966 the radio link was installed and although experimental at first most of the islanders now have individual phones and enjoy the same service as people on the mainland. The line off the island is subject to interference in bad weather but it is seldom that it is impossible to speak to people on the mainland. This is important as it is our life_line to the mainland. There is a public booth outside the Post Office which is mainly used by fishermen and yachts people or other visitors to the island. It is an old push button A and B telephone.
